summary: SN 1572 was a supernova seen in 1572 that could be seen in the constellation Cassiopeia.
full_text: SN 1572 , "B Cassiopeiae" , or 3C 10 was a supernova of Type Ia in the constellation Cassiopeia, one of about eight supernovae visible to the naked eye in historical records. It appeared in early November 1572 and was independently discovered by many individuals.
title: SN 1572
